channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5410] address list not complete
item.description: The list of the billing and shipping addresses is non containing the full list of addresses.
item.summary: address list not complete

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The problem was caused by multiple addresses with the same erpAddressId that have been created during the payment process in case of credit card usage.
The fix is to look for exactly the address with erpAddressID and the right B2BUnit owner during the login (ReadCustomer in SAP).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5383] LT // Display error at invoice history
item.description:
Mac OS X 10.9.5
Safari 7.1

https://test.distrelec.lt/my-account/invoice-history

In invoice history the word Sąskaitos in title is displayed wrong.
item.summary: LT // Display error at invoice history

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Could you please remove the invoice history for ELFA countries from the my account?
https://test.distrelec.lt/my-account/invoice-history
We only need this for NEWSAP countries --> at the moment for DE
fixed
Display is now ok.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5379] cart is not showing
item.description:
Case:
logg in as test user -> add product to cart -> cart is not showing

when i'm not logged in, the cart is showing
item.summary: cart is not showing

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5408] LT // Not possible to register as a B2B customer
item.description:
Mac OS X 10.9.5
Safari 7.1
TS-28.31

not logged in

https://test.distrelec.lt/login/checkout/register/b2b

Go to cart add some articles, click on continue check out, click on register as B2B, fill in all the data then click on register will end in an error, page complains an input error but there is no error, no possibility to register.
item.summary: LT // Not possible to register as a B2B customer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: fixed
Error still exists, I fill out the form, click on register and the system complains an error, but there is no error.
I mentioned the fix version to v3.0.m23 which is not yet deployed. So tomorrow we will be able to test it again.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5403] DE Testing - B2B not able to edit shipping address
item.description:
Requirement
The shipping addresses of B2B-Accounts should be editable upon click on icon.
item.summary: DE Testing - B2B not able to edit shipping address

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Edit shipping addresses also available for DE
Please test after the next deployment
thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5378] LT // Pay with credit card ends in an error
item.description:
Mac OS X 10.9.5
Safari 7.1
TS23.4

https://test.distrelec.lt/checkout/payment

User: distrelec.testing+lt1@gmail.com, distrelec.testing+lt2@gmail.com, pw: distrelec

Put an article in the cart, during check out choose pay with credit card, at step 4 check out an error occurs, Payment Processing Error, Error message: Unknown Method.
item.summary: LT // Pay with credit card ends in an error

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi,

The following error message is coming from DIBS. So we need to contact with technical person from DIBS to know the reason why this is coming.
The Fix has been applied, please retest it after deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5370] No function at the approval buttons (order detail)
item.description:
Case:
distrelec.testing+17-3@gmail.com
Add product to cart with over 500.- Budget, so that could be approved from manager.

logged in with distrelec.testing+17@gmail.com and tried to approve over my account -> order manager -> approval requests -> order detail -> reject (ts-37.41 test.distrelec.ch) --> nothing happens after clicking on button

Excecption:
you can reject the request (Fly Out opens (Comment Field, cancel button, submit button)
item.summary: No function at the approval buttons (order detail)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5369] open order permission in my acccount
item.description:
Hi Ruben
in my account, in open order history section the edit buttons should be disabled in case the contact is not allowed to change the open order details.

In the screenshoot you can see the button that must be disabled in case of the property isOpenOrderEditable is set to false in the open order history page.
item.summary: open order permission in my acccount

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please test after the next deployment
Thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5367] after changing shipping adress - > page not found site appears

add the new shipping address..

fixed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5357] open order close button in my-account doesn't work
item.description:
In my account page, the open order history should allow the order closing by pressing a specific button.
This button has a wrong action associated.
This button should invoke the same action used in the normal checkout review step.
item.summary: open order close button in my-account doesn't work

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The behaviour when pressing the close button should be the same of the one described in the concept.
http://concept-webshop-distrelec.namics.com/2014_08_08/start.html
Section: E180.6 - OpenOrderCloseConfirmation

user: concept-webshop-dist
pass: 53Dig&sk

Please test after the next deployment
thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5332] Test DE // Strange Calculation at the cart level
item.description:
TS30

I add the following products through direct order:

after log-in the VAT is changed!!!! Value of cart much higher!!!

Single price for this item is 90.20 CHF. But the Subtotal 72.16.

Could you please check also that one?
The prices now seems to be consistent.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5324] DE Testing - OpenOrder closing issues
item.description:
Issues

  1. Already closed openorders should not be editable.
  2. It should not be possible to add products to an already closed openorder.
  3. Already closed openorders should be shown with correct status.
  4. The earliest possible closing date should be tomorrow.
  5. @SAP: OpenOrders should be closed every day on [Time]
  6. @SAP: Check if routine is running which checks if the openorders are closed.
item.summary: DE Testing - OpenOrder closing issues

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
1. Already closed openorders should not be editable. FIXED
  2. It should not be possible to add products to an already closed openorder. FIXED
  3. Already closed openorders should be shown with correct status. this depends on SAP
  4. The earliest possible closing date should be tomorrow. FIXED
  5. @SAP: OpenOrders should be closed every day on [Time] this depends on SAP
  6. @SAP: Check if routine is running which checks if the openorders are closed. this depends on SAP

Hi Evangelos, please take care of the open points from sap-side. The closing-time will be distributed by business. The time of the day when an openorder is closed should be set on country-level. I'm waiting on an answer from business DE. thanks.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

pw: distrelec

But $

{cartData.openOrderErpCode}

is empty in checkout-review-section.jsp
Please assign to a BE engineer and then back to me when it's done.
Thanks!
Hi Francesco, please have a look. thanks.
According with Florian the project number will be hidden in case of checkout of existing open order.

Box only shown if:
a) it is not an open order
b) it is a new open order

Issue
In the detail-view of an openorder, the "close openorder"-button has no effect.

Please fix.
item.summary: DE Testing - OpenOrder close button

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Hi Ruben
The close button action is correct in the checkout review page, but the concept show that a lightbox must be displayed to confirm the close of the order.

http://concept-webshop-distrelec.namics.com/2014_08_08/start.html
Section: E180.6 - OpenOrderCloseConfirmation
user: concept-webshop-dist
pass: 53Dig&sk

Please test after the next deployment.
Thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5314] DE Testing - Openorder Projektnummer
item.description:
Issue

  1. If openorder-details of a new openorder are opened, there is a standard-value present in the "Projektnummer"-field. -> Please change to nothing as standard.
  2. If this is tried to be changed via edit button and saved, the same standard-value as before is still placed in this field. when going back to the overview, the change is present.
  3. in checkout step 3 the value is not diplayed.
  4. if lightbox to edit the reference is openend, the updated value is not present, only the standard text.
item.summary: DE Testing - Openorder Projektnummer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi Ruben, if you need help please ask francesco.

Please test after the next deployment
Thanks!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4697] FF Links - New attribute
item.description:
Actual situation:
If linking to a specific product-list by adding the products via link to a factfinder search the search-terms are visible at the top(like: 123456|654321|...). The problem is that this does not look nice and costs space.

New requirement:
Please implement an attribute to be passed via URL-Link to factfinder/hybris in order to not display the search-terms if this attribute is set.

Example link:
http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=1435-HQ-LED
item.summary: FF Links - New attribute

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Thanks for fixing this. Tell me if you need more specs.
S

Hoi Sarah, hierzu noch ein paar fragen:

  1. Soll sich dies bei solch spezifischen suchanfragen auch auf die Banner anwenden? Respektive soll dieser auch ausgeblendet werden?
  2. Wollt Ihr nur dass der Titel(und evt. banner) weg geht oder dass Ihr auch etwas anders als replacement übergeben könnt?
  3. Was ist mit dem sucheingabefeld, soll es da auch weg?

Hoi Rafi

Wann immer wir dieses Attribut an die Such-URL anhängen, soll alles ausgeblendet werden. Sowohl im Suchfeld, in der Bread-crumb als auch der Titel. Banner sollen drin bleiben und entsprechend hoch gerückt werden.

Wie würde so ein URL-Parameter aussehen? Ähnlich wie "&log=internal"?

Gruss, Sarah

They would like to have the possibility to add an additional parameter to the search query URL (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=1435-HQ-LED?removetitle) to remove all elements above the banner in the screenshot.

  • Title "Sie suchten nach..."
  • Breadcrump "Icon / home / search keyword"
  • Search keyword in the search field. Search field should be empty

The banner (if existing) and the search result list should be moved below the search field.

I was talking to Daniela and our requirements/changes are affecting all FACT-Finder search results. Please don't change anything that we have requested! We can live without that and try to link our campaigns more to product families.
There is a proposal from Florian (screenshot attached) how we could improve the search queries by adding *Gefundene Produkte für "led"" This would make sense for us as well.
BR, Sarah

Hi Flo

Please reassign to Nabil. We just discussed it again and he said it's a quick fix that only takes him around 1 hour of work.

BR, Marc

Fixed. You will be able to test the removetitle parameter after next deployment.

Example of URL: http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=led&removetitle=true

Note: if the removetitle parameter equals to false or it is not added to the URL, then the default value is false.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4237] currencies: isocode or symbol
item.description:
There are two different ways to display currencies:

  • LTL (isocode) used e.g. on home (isocodes of other countries are CHF, PLN, GBP, USD, ...)
  • Lt (symbol) used in the product detail page (symbols of other countries are CHF, zł, £, $, ...)

=> Please decide how to display.
item.summary: currencies: isocode or symbol

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Decision Florian: ISO

Checked the currencies and changed were necessary.

Changes were needed in:

  • Buying Section
  • Div. cart price calculation boxes
  • Product compare view

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3218] Additional Event-Tracking of Clicks on Teaser-Tracking Elements
item.description:
For all Webtrekk Teaser-Tracking implementations (compare WT-Spec chapter 9) the following functional amendment (Event-Tracking – compare WT-Spec chapter 8.2 p. 18/19) is required regarding click-event on any teaser-elements:

"onclick=wt.sendinfo(

{linkId:'[[Teaser-Tracking ID]]',sendOnUnload:1}

);"

Thereby two Webtrekk-requests are fired when a user is clicking on any teaser-element.

Briefly pre-discussed the above requirements with Dominic Modalek via phone (12.2.14).

Thanks! Mark
item.summary: Additional Event-Tracking of Clicks on Teaser-Tracking Elements

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Estimate 3 Days Frontend Work. No Backend Work needed.

This change affects many different components and therefore needs some time to implement and test.
Reconsider after go-live of 1.1

Mark, I assign it to you until this will be reconsidered again.

Info: only track onClick, not on shifting to the left or right in a carousel.

Hi Florian

To be foreseen for v1.3 if possible.

Thx Mark
Could you please check with Dominic what it needs do be done?

Dominic,
can you do a rough effort estimation for planning?

I estimate 3 - 4 days for this change.

Mainly because there are so many different modules involved that must be changed and tested. See Chapter 8 https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation for an Overview.

Florian,
please evaluate the priority of this task (in the context of FE bugs, FF improvements and ELFA development)

Please allocate and assign accordingly.

Thx Mark

Implemented. See 9.3 Click on Teaser Items - Always activated:

https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation

Tested every occurence with a HTTP Sniffer and all IDs seem to be transmitted correctly. Only the "Feedback Campaign" Product Teaser could not be tested locally, so please don't forget to test it on the Q System.

@ Dominic -> Fix Version?

Thx Mark

Hi Dominic,

I have tested the implementation on distrelec.at. On the Homepage (Carpet) on click on a teaser-item two requests are transmitted (as required - compare attached screenshots): A request showing the click-event (ck524: 1) and another one transmitting the ct-parameter.
Please note that if the teaser is not containing a product, the image-name is so far not transmitted as part of the ct-parameter value (compare red arrow in screenshot).

Other Teaser-implementations such onsite-search overview (e.g. http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone) and 'Ähnliche Produkte' respectively 'Kunden, die diesen Artikel gekauft haben, kauften auch' (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Office-2013-Professional-eng-Microsoft-269-16093/p/11063276) do onclick not transmitting a request containing a ct-parameter. Besides a request containing the click-event (ck524: 1) is not transmitted.

Please verify and refactor accordingly.

Bests, Mark

Hello Mark, we need some explanation regarding this ticket.

  • Why currently there is some webtrekk argument in the URL of the banner image here?: http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone
    If you inspect the element you can find: &wt_mc=at.faf-c.de.-
    This is not suppose to be there, is it?
  • This URL comes from CMS cockpit, so we can't modify it.

+ we can fix the carpet-item-teaser errors regarding the wrong "data-teasertrackingid" element.

Hi Ruben

As far as I am aware this has so far been manually added to the target-link by Daniela Truttmann (Fact-Finder Business-Owner) to have a tracking-indication for that functionality.
As soon as the teaser-tracking for Fact-Finder Feedback-Campaigns (I have assigned you DISTRELEC-3415 as well in this regard) is fully and properly implemented, we can inform Daniela that she does not need to add the mentioned parameter via CMS any longer.

Next to the carpet-item-teaser errors I would like to ask you to investigate into every teaser-tracking implementation (please align with Dominic in this regard) and check whether all specified parameters are transmitted given an according behaviour (view, click etc.). As indicated e.g. so far Views are not yet properly tracked for the Hero-teaser items. If required you can set-up a meeting with Dominic and me (-> to be coordinated by Florian).

Thx Mark

Please estimate the effort.
Thx

Refactoring-scope of ticket according to the attached .xls-file.

Mark

As discussed I adapted the refactoring-scope of this ticket (compare attached .xls-file: Distrelec_Webtrekk_Teaser-Tracking-Implementierung_Overview_MDI_v1.1_14-08-27.xlsx).

Mark
Ruben, could you reestimate the ticket based on the change we have disccused with Mark Diggelmann.

Hello Mark,
please test after the next Q deployment
Thanks!

Hi Mark,

I have a question regarding the teaser / title click tracking of the product listing:

I assume, that the tracking should also work for products loaded by a click on the show more button or the technical switch buttons? Because so far we only implemented the tracking for products loaded by a standard page load and not by ajax..

BR Jan

Hi Jan

Thanks for your input. That's correct. The teaser-tracking shall be accordingly implemented for products loaded by Ajax.

Mark

Verified and tested today on test.distrelec.at (v2.0.25). Three remaining issues:

  • Product listings: The teaser-tracking shall be accordingly implemented for products loaded by Ajax (compare input from Jan Widmer above).
    On click (on image/title/table) the ct-request is triggered however with a wrong ID (e.g. '.770111.' -> required for .at: 'at.ons.770111.') and the click itself is not tracked so far.

http://test.distrelec.at/de/Galaxy-S4-active-I9295-schwarz-16-GB-Samsung-GT-I9295ZAA/p/11056417

  • Image-gallery: Upon click on a 'large' image no click-request is triggered so far.
  • Ähnliche Produkte / Zubehör: By clicking on the title the click is not tracked and the ct-request not triggered so far.

Please verify and refactor accordingly

Thx Mark

Please verify the remaining 3 issues after the next deployment.
Thanks
Ruben
Can we close this?

No this must be (re-) tested on v2.0.28.

Mark

Verified and tested today on test.distrelec.ch (v2.0.28). One remaining issue:

  • Product listings: The teaser-tracking shall be accordingly implemented for products loaded by Ajax (compare input from Jan Widmer above).
    On click (on image/title/table) the ct-request is triggered however with a wrong ID (e.g. 'ch.ons...' -> required for .at: 'ch.ons.770111.') and the click itself is still not tracked so far.

Mark

Tested locally, apparently fine for products loaded by Ajax: Technical View, Show More Products, and Filters.
Please see attachment and test in Atos.
Thanks

Tested and verified in Atos (test.a.distrelec.de, v3.0.m12). Compare attach screenshot in this regard, verify and refactor accordingly.

Mark

Sorry Mark,
I forgot to mention the resolution version: v3.0.m13
Please test when is deployed
Thanks

Verified and tested today on test.distrelec.ch (v3.0.m15).

  • ct-request (on image/title/table): Triggered / ID correct

Remaining issue:

  • click-tracking: So far only working for a click on table. So far not yet for image- and title-links.

Please verify and refactor.

Thx Mark

Please test after the next deployment.
Thanks,
Ruben

Verified and tested today on test.distrelec.ch (v3.0.m19).

Issue still remaining (regarding loaded products by Ajax at product listings):

click-tracking: So far only working for a click on table. So far not yet for image- and title-links.

Please verify and refactor.

Thx Mark

The tags are the same in the Table than in the Title/Image, and the webtrekk call is exactly the same. But for some reason is still not working:

<div class="table" ...

data-teasertrackingid="ch.faf-s.plg.765391.-"
data-position="9"
data-wt-teaser="{ ct: 'ch.faf-s.plg.765391.', ck: { 520: '9', 521: 'ch.faf-s.plg.765391.', 526: '1', 527:''}}">

<a class="title-link" ...

data-teasertrackingid="ch.faf-s.plg.765391.-"
data-position="9"
data-wt-teaser="{ ct: 'ch.faf-s.plg.765391.', ck: { 520: '9', 521: 'ch.faf-s.plg.765391.', 526: '1', 527:''}}">

Tested and verified today (v3.0.m22).

The click-tracking for products loaded by Ajax at product listings and on the technical view is now working properly (for both on image/title/table). Now however the campaign-request (ct) is not accordingly triggered anymore.

Please verify and refactor!

Mark

Please test after the next deployment.
Thanks,
